title: (x) Serif text face on Hoefler & Frere Jones site - Georgia {Stephen, Raph}
content:
Hi there,  
Can anyone tell me the name of the serif typeface used in Hoefler & Frere-Jones website [http://typography.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20060113053228/http:/typography.com/) in the section that reads “What’s New: From a crisp family of display faces to the four grades of text face engineered and tested for the demanding environment of newspaper printing, Mercury is a type family designed to meet the needs of the most exacting typographer. Its sixty-nine styles include all the trimmings, right down to 74 symbols designed to thrive at small sizes”? I don’t think it is Mercury (is it Georgia?).  
Thanks
author: Ben_Edwards

comments.content: Yes. And you’re reading it right now.
